definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Those two weak boys are distant relations.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個瘦弱的男孩是遠房親戚。

sentences.english: Talent is merely success’s distant cousin.
sentences.chinese: 而天賦只是成功的遠房外甥。

sentences.english: She says, I am the great great grand cousin of the queen of France.
sentences.chinese: 她說，我是法蘭西皇后的遠遠遠房表親。

sentences.english: Except for a cousin, I was the first in my family to go to college.
sentences.chinese: 除了一個遠房堂兄，我是家裏第一個考上大學的人。

sentences.english: We beat up the quarters of some of our less-known relatives in New York last time we went there.
sentences.chinese: 上次到紐約時，我們走訪了一些家住那裏的遠房親戚。

sentences.english: I met her just once, and she's only a second cousin by marriage.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我只和她見了一面，而她只是一個遠房親戚。

sentences.english: She is one of my distant relatives .
They sat down to meat with a distant cousin of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他們便坐下來，同一個遠房表親一起用飯。

sentences.english: He inherited a big fortune from a remote relative.
sentences.chinese: 他承繼了遠房親戚的一大筆財富。

sentences.english: Those two boys are distant relations.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個男孩是遠房親戚。
